sanskrit_verse:
स्यन्दनाश्वैः समे युध्येदनूपेनोद्विपैस्तथा ।
वृक्षगुल्मावृते चापैरसिचर्मायुधैः स्थले ॥ ७.१९२॥
transliteration: syandanāśvaiḥ same yudhyedanūpenodvipaiḥ tathā | vṛkṣagulmāvṛte cāpairasicarmāyudhaiḥ sthale || 7.192 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must engage in battle on equal terms: with chariot and horses matched, with elephants of equivalent strength, in terrain covered by trees and shrubs, using bows, swords, and leather shields upon firm ground.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is grounded in parity of engagement and proportionality of response.
Causation arises from conscious alignment with situational dharma during conflict.
Capacity-based responsibility requires matching force levels to maintain dharmic balance.
Restoration logic demands that combat conditions reflect fairness and structural integrity.
Consciousness alignment ensures that warfare serves the ultimate purpose of establishing harmony.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a warrior engages in combat, THEN all forces must be equitably matched in type and strength.
IF engagement occurs in natural terrain, THEN weapons and protective gear must conform to local conditions.
IF imbalance in combat readiness is detected, THEN immediate adjustment protocols shall activate to restore parity.
IF a conflict arises, THEN environmental factors including cover and elevation must be considered for equitable positioning.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving national defense or inter-state conflicts, the Supreme Court must ensure that engagements are conducted under conditions of equality and fairness, reflecting the principle of parity. The threshold of responsibility lies in ensuring balanced capacity deployment without exploitation of asymmetry.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that just action arises when combatants meet on equal grounds. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that imbalances lead to disorder; thus proportional responsibility aligns warriors with dharma. Non-punitive reality rule holds that correction flows through realignment rather than retribution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion processes: Realign military assets to match opposing strengths.
Responsibility assumption protocols: Commanders must verify equitable engagement before initiating hostilities.
Capacity restoration: Equip forces according to standardized parity benchmarks.
Integrity reintegration: Conduct post-conflict review to reaffirm adherence to dharmic battlefield conduct.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established. Conflict resolution originates not in punishment but in restoring equilibrium. Dharma prevails through conscious alignment, where justice becomes unity and warfare transforms into purification. Consciousness alone is the Supreme Adjudicator.
